sen.j: 姉小路家（あねがこうじけ／あねこうじけ）は、藤原氏系の公家の家系である。
sen.e: The Anegakoji/Anekoji family is a court noble of the Fujiwara lineage.
The Anegakoji/Anekoji clan were court nobility of Fujiwara lineage.
sen.cmt: Changed to more natural English. Also changed "family" to "clan" as per the term list of 8/5.
sen.e: The Anegakoji/Anekoji family were court nobility of Fujiwara lineage.

sen.j: 大きく分けると閑院流（1・2）、小一条流（3：飛騨国国司）、勧修寺流（4）の3つの家系がある。
sen.e: Roughly classified, the family consists of three pedigrees; Kanin-ryu (1.2), Koichijo-ryu (3: the governor of the Province of Hida), and Kajuji-ryu (4).
In the broadest sense, the family had three lines, a Kanin line (1 and 2), a Koichijo line (3, governors of Hida Province Hida), and a Kajuji line (4).

sen.j: なお、3.の姉小路家の名跡を継承した戦国大名（旧宇多源氏三木氏）については、姉小路氏の項目で解説を行う。
sen.e: The warring lord (the Miki family of the old Uda Genji) which took over the name of the Anegakoji/Anekoji family of 3. is described in the entry of the Anegakoji/Anekoji clan.
The daimyo of the warring states period (the Miki family of the old Uda Genji) who took over the name of the Anegakoji/Anekoji clan (3) are described in the entry for the Anegakoji/Anekoji clan.

The daimyo of the warring states period (the Miki clan of the old Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan)) who took over the name of the Anegakoji/Anekoji clan (3) are described in the entry for the Anegakoji/Anekoji clan.

sen.j: 閑院流（藤原公季の子孫）三条公教の子、姉小路公宣が京の姉小路に居を構えた事に由来する。
sen.e: The name came from the fact that Kiminobu ANEGAKOJI, the son of Kiminori SANJO of Kanin-ryu (the descendant of FUJIWARA no Kinsue), built his residence on Anegakoji-Street in Kyoto.
The name Anegakoji came from the fact that Kiminobu, the son of Kiminori SANJO of the Kanin line (descendants of FUJIWARA no Kinsue), built his residence on Anegakoji-Street in Kyoto.
The name Anegakoji came from the fact that Kiminobu ANEGAKOJ, the son of Kiminori SANJO of the Kanin line (descendants of FUJIWARA no Kinsue), built his residence on Anegakoji-Street in Kyoto.

sen.j: 6代目の姉小路実広が吉野朝廷に従って没落する。
sen.e: Sanehiro ANEGAKOJI, the 6th head of the family, followed Yoshino Imperial Court and was downfallen.
Sanehiro ANEGAKOJI, the 6th head was ruined after following the Yoshino Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: The phrase "was downfallen" is very unnatural in English. I have tried to correct to more natural English, but I am not sure exactly what the source text means.
sen.e: Sanehiro ANEGAKOJI, the sixth head was ruined after following the Yoshino Imperial Court.

sen.j: 同じく閑院流阿野実顕の子、姉小路公景が慶長18年（1613年）に新たな姉小路家を起こす（ちなみに阿野家も1.の姉小路家共々南朝方について一度は没落したが、後に勢力を回復させた家系である）。
sen.e: Kinkage ANEGAKOJI, the son of Saneaki ANO of Kanin-ryu newly established a new Anegakoji family in 1613 (incidentally, the Ano family was also downfallen once supporting the southern dynasty together with the Anegakoji family of 1. and regained the power).

Kinkage ANEGAKOJI, the son of Saneaki ANO of the Kanin line established a new Anegakoji family in 1613 (note that the Ano family was ruined like the Anegakoji family (1) after supporting the southern dynasty, but subsequently managed to recover power).

Kinkage ANEGAKOJI, the son of Saneaki ANO of the Kanin line established a new Anegakoji family in 1613 (note that the Ano family was ruined like the Anegakoji family (1) after supporting the southern dynasty, but subsequently managed to recover power).

sen.j: 当初は1.とは無関係に存在していたが、宝暦9年（1759年）に時の桃園天皇の命により、1.の祭祀を引き継ぐ事になった。
sen.e: At first, the family existed unrelated with 1.; however, it took over the religious service from 1. by the order of the then Emperor Momozono.
Initially, the Ano family was unrelated to (1), but was ordered to take over religious duties from (1) by the order of the then Emperor Momozono.
Initially, the Ano family was unrelated to (1), but was ordered to take over religious duties from (1) in 1759 by the order of the then Emperor Momozono.

sen.j: 幕末の姉小路公知とその叔父で澤家を継いだ澤宣嘉は著名である。
sen.e: Kintomo ANEGAKOJI and his uncle Nobuyoshi SAWA, who succeeded to the Sawa family, at the end of Edo Period were famous.
Kintomo ANEGAKOJI and his uncle Nobuyoshi SAWA, who became head of the Sawa family were prominent figures at the end of Edo Period.

sen.j: 小一条流藤原師尹の子である藤原済時が京の姉小路に居を構えた事から、子孫が姉小路を称する事となった。
sen.e: As FUJIWARA no Naritoki, the son of FUJIWARA no Morotada of Koichijo-ryu, built his residence on Anegakoji-Street in Kyoto, his descendant called themselves ANEGAKOJI.
FUJIWARA no Naritoki, the son of FUJIWARA no Morotada of the Koichijo line, built his residence on Anegakoji-Street in Kyoto, and this led to his descendants calling themselves ANEGAKOJI.

sen.j: 建武の新政で飛騨国国司に任じられた参議姉小路高基が下向した事から、以後代々飛騨国司家とされた。
sen.e: As the Councilor Takamoto ANEGAKOJI was appointed to be the provincial governor of Hida and went down to the province at Kemmu Restoration, it became the family of the governor of the Province of Hida for generations since then.
Councilor Takamoto ANEGAKOJI moved to Hida Province to take up the post of governor after the Kemmu Restoration, and the family subsequently provided governors of the Hida Province for generations.
Councilor Takamoto ANEGAKOJI moved to Hida Province to take up the post of governor after the Kenmu Restoration, and the family subsequently provided governors of Hida Province for generations.

sen.j: だが、室町幕府の派遣した守護京極氏に敗れ、一族自体も小島家（宗家）と古河家・向小島家に分裂した。
sen.e: However, it was defeated by the Kyogoku family, the provincial constable dispatched by Muromachi Shogunate, and the family was also split into the Kojima family (the head of the family) and the Furukawa family/the Mukaikojima family.

However, the family was defeated by the Kyogoku clan sent to look after Hida Province by the Muromachi Shogunate, and split into the Kojima family (the head of the family) and the Furukawa/Mukaikojima family.

sen.j: その後、古河家の姉小路基嗣・姉小路済継が小島家を圧倒して宗家の地位を奪うが、息子に先立たれた済継が死亡すると、同家は断絶状態となる。
sen.e: Afterward, Mototsugu ANEGAKOJI and Naritsugu ANEGAKOJI of the Furukawa family overwhelmed the Kojima family and deprived them of the position of the head of the family; however, when Naritsugu, whose son died on him, was dead, the family was failed.

sen.e: Tokimitsu later fought against the army of Nagachika KANAMORI, who was commanded by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, with Yoritsuna but was destroyed, and the Anegakoji family was fallen both in name and in reality.

sen.e: The three generations of the descendants of FUJIWARA no Munetaka who was the courtier in the Kamakura Period and the 7th generation of FUJIWARA no Nobutaka of Kajuji-ryu (the husband of Murasaki Shikibu), Munekata ANEGAKOJI (the son of Munetaka), Akitomo ANEGAKOJI, and TADAKATA ANEGAKOJI had ruined early.
